intro: [WRONG START] Phyllanthus ankaratray, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
